The two biggest one day point gains for the DJIA (which were also 10%+ gains) came in October 2008- a month when the index was down over 14% (October 2008).
And the DJIA was still down 14% that month.
Anything above +620 would be a top three one-day point gain for the DJIA. Top two (936 and 889) were in October 2008.

11) Finally, $ FB stock has posted one-day gains following each of its last four January earnings reports. https://www.bespokepremium.com/bespoke-interactive-databases/ …
10) Prior to last quarter, $ FB had rallied on the day of its last four earnings reports.
9) $ FB has only had two earnings reports where it gapped down at the open and also traded down from the open to close. One was last qtr.
8) When $ FB has gapped down at the open on earnings, investors have stepped in and bid the stock up 1.74% from the open to close of trading.
7) Historically when $ FB has gapped up at the open on earnings, it has averaged a decline of 0.57% from the open to close of trading.
6) $ FB's biggest one-day gain on earnings came following its 7/24/13 report when it rallied 29.61%.https://www.bespokepremium.com/bespoke-interactive-databases/ …
5) $ FB's biggest one-day decline on earnings came following its very first earnings report on 7/26/12, when it fell 11.70% on the day.
4) In terms of price reaction, $ FB stock has averaged a gain of 4.31% on its earnings reaction days following its 18 prior reports.
3) This gives $ FB an earnings and revenue beat rate" of 94.4%. Pretty good. But means expectations are always enormously high."

Finally, huge jump in state/local gov't contribution as it swings +0.3 ppt QoQ SAAR from Q3 to Q4, but federal spending swings -0.24 ppt.
Investment in both housing and business fixed assets was solid, added about 30 bps QoQ SAAR to total growth each.
Inventory added 1.0 ppt QoQ SAAR in Q4. Inventory cycle rebound was to be expected but that's still a big number!
Surge in imports drove the miss; deducted -1.17 ppt QoQ SAAR from total growth, all goods imports.

So today we're seeing sell the news" regardless of how the numbers look."
What's notable is that 70% of stocks that reported today beat estimates, which is inline with beat rate up to this point...
Takes the average one-day change for all stocks that have reported this season from +0.20% to -0.33%.
104 stocks that reported last night and this AM are down an average of 1.76% today!
Prior to today, 279 stocks had reported this season with an average one-day % chg of 0.20% on earnings reaction day...
